bug.short_desc: Temporarily visible on the wrong monitor
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When you open the guake terminal, it temporarily appears on my left monitor and you can visually see it scoot its way over to the right monitor.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
How reproducible: 100% on Wayland. Can't reproduce on X.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. You need two monitors 2. Press F12 to open the guake terminal while mouse is on the right monitor 3. Slight delay while you see it appear on left then move
Actual results: Opens on left
Expected results: Opens on right (where my mouse was located)
Additional info: I've attempted to fix this issue myself, but I don't really know gtk or python for that matter, so maybe it helps maybe it doesn't. Works for me using Gnome with Wayland and X.
